result.execSummary:
The defendant Rodney L Olson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 813.12(8)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
All financials same as noted above.

Obtain Domestic Violence assessment through a certified (WBTP) Wisconsin batterer's treatment provider and followthrough with all treatment recommendations.
Psychological assessment and followthrough.
No contact with victim without Agent approval.
Defendant allowed to work at Sunset Bar.
To have pictures & prints taken for this case.

charges.descr: Knowingly Violate a Domestic Abuse Order - Temporary Restraining Order

to modify sentence

Rodney Olson sworn and testifies regarding his motion.  Court believes defendant would qualify for the ankle monitor if defendant can provide to the WRC the necessary paperwork from his doctor explaining the time limits, etc.  If the proper information is provided he should be able to work out and implement the treatment.

Arguments as to penalty by both attorneys.  Court imposes and stays 30 days jail, 18 months probation with conditions.
